intro: Diphasiastrum sitchense, commonly known as the Sichuan clubmoss, is a species of spore-bearing plant belonging to the family Lycopodiaceae. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and the presence of small, club-shaped strobili that produce spores. Native to the mountainous regions of China, this plant thrives in cool, moist environments with well-drained soil. Its leaves are typically narrow and arranged in whorls around the stem, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Diphasiastrum sitchense plays a role in forest ecosystems by providing habitat and contributing to soil stability.
